summary: For the fic prompts: 44 for Aziracrow, please?
question: For the fic prompts: 44 for Aziracrow, please?
answer:
Crowley had spent whole nights with Aziraphale before. Most of those, they had been drinking and forgetting time until the morning light shone in through the impeccably cleaned windows of the flat above the bookshop.

This was different. For one thing, they hadn’t gotten drunk. For another, there was a whole lot more touching than ever before. They weren’t at the point yet, where Crowley would have liked to be for literal thousands of years, but Aziraphale had barely let go off his hand all night, pressing himself close to Crowley, holding on to him like a lifeline. It felt good, exactly right – as much as if could be right for a demon to enjoy an angel’s close presence.

Crowley assumed, it was different, because he was in love with said angel.

He had been surprised, when he woke up before Aziraphale did, but then proceeded to slowly pull back from the embrace he was being held in. Without even thinking about it, he grabbed something that looked vaguely wearable off the chair next to the bedroom door, and went to take a nice hot shower. When he stepped out of the bathroom, refreshed, but cosy and warm, dressed in nothing but briefs and the shirt he had taken from Aziraphale’s chair, he cracked his neck, while he made his way to the small kitchen.

He made himself an espresso – not because he needed it, but simply because it was one of the tastes, he had come to quite enjoy over the past decades – and was just picking up the cup from underneath the uncharacteristically expensive coffee maker, when he heard soft footsteps coming to a halt at the door.

“Crowley?” Aziraphale asked softly and the demon in question needed to carefully reign in his expression, so as not to show, that he had just impossibly fallen even more in love. He turned around and gave the angel a smile.

“Who else?”

“Nothing… umm, nobody. I just –“ he stammered and Crowley’s smile widened, just a bit.

“What is it, angel?” he asked and took a sip of his coffee. He didn’t mind that it was still scalding hot.

“You look uh, you look good,” Aziraphale said and blushed. He was adorable. His hair was still mussed from a good night’s sleep. The dressing gown, he had put on, made him look smaller than he was, especially, because he tried to hide in it.

“Ah, thank you,” Crowley replied and set down the cup on the kitchen table, before he took a couple of steps in Aziraphale’s direction.

“Is that… my shirt?” the angel asked, and Crowley merely shrugged.

“I needed one,” he added after a moment.

Aziraphale just looked at him, then held out a hand.

“Come back to bed.”

“I thought you didn’t like sleeping.”

Aziraphale’s blush became even more obvious.

“Can’t sleep anymore. But I want to hold you.”

Crowley’s heart was beating a very unhealthy-sounding rhythm, as he took the offered hand.

“Okay,” he breathed.

When he found himself in bed, his head on Aziraphale’s chest, closing his eyes, and took a deep breath, the angel spoke up once more.

“Oh, and like this, you don’t have to steal my clothes to smell me.”

As much as the demon frowned at that, he couldn’t stop a blush creeping into his own cheeks.

summary: What a splendid thought! Aziraphale manipulating and destroying people who may cause harm to his husband! Crowley pleasantly...
question: What a splendid thought! Aziraphale manipulating and destroying people who may cause harm to his husband! Crowley pleasantly smirking while being "saved". Oh angel, you slay me!
answer:
Ask: What a splendid thought! Aziraphale manipulating and destroying people who may cause harm to his husband! Crowley pleasantly smirking while being “saved”. Oh angel, you slay me!

I do like the idea of Crowley effectively managing his chaotic existence to the extent that he doesn’t ever need to be legitimately saved by his Angel bf.

But I do think that Crowley, who blocked all cell services and then needed to make a call and also created an inferno freeway which he then needed to drive though - if not threatened by anyone else, may at the very least need to be saved from himself.

tags: i had to write this down before i forgot it
summary: And my brain immediately went to spirited away and how Haku lost his true name to Yubaba so he was doomed to be in her service...
body:
So Michael did this

And my brain immediately went to spirited away and how Haku lost his true name to Yubaba so he was doomed to be in her service for all time … and well if you haven’t seen spirited away first of all idk what you’re doing with your life and secondly l am about to spoil it a little bit. Chihiro spends a lot of time with Haku, a boy who has magical powers, and he seems familiar to her. Eventually she remembers that as a little kid she was washed away in a river and the river spirit saved her life. That river was the Kohaku river … and she realizes that Haku is really the Spirit of the Kohaku River. The spell is broken and he is free forever.

I just…What if once Crowley fell he forgot his true heavenly name? What if everyone did? But what would happen if Aziraphale one day remembered it?

summary: i love this part in the book because it really encompasses aziraphale's conflict between crowley and heaven. he knows that it's...
body:
i love this part in the book because it really encompasses aziraphale’s conflict between crowley and heaven. he knows that it’s ingrained in him to trust heaven first, knows that its the “good” thing to do and yet-

his first thought is still crowley.

I do commissions - info's on the top of my page. Support me on ko-fi at ko-fi.com/thefrenchbelphegor.

summary: A quick Aziraphale before the heat wave hits and it gets too hot to turn on the computer. Favourite angel of all time as far as...
caption: A quick Aziraphale before the heat wave hits and it gets too hot to turn on the computer. Favourite angel of all time as far as I’m concerned. Because, as @ineffableplan so perfectly put it: “He’s soft and queer and vain and he loves food and these are good qualities! These things are his and he wears them openly and defiantly and they make him strong in a way heaven doesn’t comprehend!” (x) (I love everything about this post and its reblogs, tbh.)

summary: Listen, I truly adore the headcanon that Crowley was whining to Shakespeare about his love for Aziraphale and that's how Romeo...
body:
Listen, I truly adore the headcanon that Crowley was whining to Shakespeare about his love for Aziraphale and that’s how Romeo and Juliet was concieved. However Billy It’s-Not-Plagirism-But-Simply-Creative-Inspiration Shakespeare didn’t invent the story, he “took inspiration” from Italian poems about that exact couple from almost 100 years prior, the actual story was much older.

But bearing with the fact that Romeo and Juliet was, in fact, inspired by Crowley’s pining, it’s possible to assume that in the time span of the 14th and 15th centuries, Crowley was dealing with his Many Feelings by whining to anyone and everyone about his plight, perhaps even when tempting a poet or two, who found this to be an excellent concept.

And then in Elizabethan times Aziraphale (who’s probably been a fan of Shakespeare since his first plays) takes Crowley to see Romeo and Juliet because “you simply must, my dear!” and Crowley has to stand there, right next to Aziraphale, listening to Romeo pine and be helpless for two hours straight, and pretend he’s not in full Gay Panic TM mode.

And if you’re a fan of the idea that Aziraphale was fully aware of his feelings for Crowley before 1941 (not my cup of tea but who am I to judge what people ship and headcanon, an ex Voltron stan?) then in that case it could be that Aziraphale took Crowley to see Romeo and Juliet so Crowley might Get A hINT, and he too, was in full Gay Panic mode because Crowley was RigHt tHeRE! and to him that was probably a Very Obvious move.
